TopicTitle: Should vens stock revamp be stock.

Articles.Content:
So I was thinking of how much I love vsr, and wondered why the hell it hasn't been implemented into stock. So thought I'd make this topic, cos... I felt like it.

 

 

Edited July 1, 2016 by SmashBrown
Porkjet's been redoing the rocket parts for the 1.2 update, so the topic's moot.
This is what happens when  I'm not on the forums for months. /fail
Can I vote for NecroBones?
Nah.

I'd vote "hell yeah" if the alternative was what we have now. If the alternative is a new set of consistent parts that don't look like rubbish (i.e.: pretty much any change from the extant rocket parts), then I'm willing to give those a try. I might be more willing to wait simply because I no longer use the stock parts because they are so awful, so I'm not even used to seeing them at this point.

The stock KSP parts need redesign. And Ven's Revamp has some good ideas (design and parts, especially engines with different diameter mounts).

But Ven's Revamp is quite particular in terms of style and I understand that some users wouldn't like it. So no to it in stock.

Edited July 1, 2016 by Gaarst
Removed a repeated word

Just checked out the image album on the mod page and...

I don't really care for it, no offense to the creator as that just boils down to personal opinion.

No accounting for taste as they say.

Edited July 1, 2016 by Rocket In My Pocket
Looking forward to seeing what porkjet does with the rest of the parts.

9 hours ago, SmashBrown said:

So I was thinking of how much I love vsr, and wondered why the hell it hasn't been implemented into stock. So thought I'd make this topic, cos... I felt like it.

Even though you didn't get the response you hoped for - thanks for making this topic to spread the word about the greatest mod ever! So glad to find someone else who agrees with me

I recently downloaded it for the first time and I was blown away. I pretty much never wanna play without it again. My first installed mod used to be DOE. It is now VSR. 

3 hours ago, Rocket In My Pocket said:

Just checked out the image album on the mod page and...

I don't really care for it, no offense to the creator as that just boils down to personal opinion.

No accounting for taste as they say.

I took one look at the glorious but subtle way the MK1-2 pod was fixed and never looked back! And the new Terrier! And the new Poodle with proper engine bell!! 

Sorry I'll stop now..

I like VSR, I use it a lot. But it does have it's own distinct non-stock style. Much more realistic, less cartoony. I find that when I use it with other mods, I end up reverting some of the parts (the pods, hitchhiker, lab, mostly stuff that has hatches) back to stock, just because the style difference is so jarring. But the other stuff, engines, tanks, structural parts, they're unreservedly awesome. 

In any case, I think that petitioning for it to be made stock is sort of moot at this point, considering that the developers already decided to have PorkJet do an art pass on the parts for 1.2. My guess is that they aren't going to just toss that out the window and pull VSR into stock instead.

I think the only thing that drags me away from the vanilla style at this point is how some parts look like they're re-used oil barrels. Or simply stuff that was never intended to go into space.  I would love to see the art pass make all of the parts a bit more space-worthy.
I mostly can't even tell the difference between this and most of the stock parts, except for the fuel tanks which have become even more awful.

I think ProkJet shoule handle it. There used to be a few artists in the past reworking the parts and that's what made them so inconsistent.

These switchable tank butts are pretty dope tho

Edited April 17, 2017 by Veeltch

I looked at some of the pictures and they looked rather like plastic parts to me, maybe it's a generational thing: I'm semi-prejudiced against plastic, to my 83 year old mom all plastic is junk (even HMW plastic  ).

On July 1, 2016 at 10:35 PM, trippytripp said:

I think the only thing that drags me away from the vanilla style at this point is how some parts look like they're re-used oil barrels. Or simply stuff that was never intended to go into space.  I would love to see the art pass make all of the parts a bit more space-worthy.

Well I sort of agree that it doesn't look the best, but the part descriptions usually say that the parts aren't space worthy! Which makes sense for early tech tree stuff as well, rockets a being duct taped together. Maybe there could be tech nodes that upgrade the all the early "found by the side of the road" parts into better shinier parts instead of adding new ones with maybe an option to toggle the tech level.

I abstained from voting because whilst I really like Ven's mod, I doubt its likely - or appropriate - that squad will just dump the majority of their part models and textures in exchange for some 3rd party ones.
I don't have a strong opinion either way, so vote to keep 'em the same (or more accurately, vote that Squad change them according to their current plans instead of changing those plans).
Bump? Apparently we're never getting a full revamp of everything, so this is now a bit more relevant.

Very much so, I can't play the game without it anymore and the parts fit seamlessly with the porkjet parts which the modmaker even leaves untouched.

 

...With the exception of the docking ports, you'd have to make the extendable ports into the ven version.

Edited April 16, 2017 by Spartwo

Nononononononononononono

Edited April 16, 2017 by Red Iron Crown
Don't spam, please.
Why not?
It has a particular style that might not be for everyone, while the current parts are ok.... They could definitely use work, but personally I don't see a problem with the current parts

but personally I don't see a problem with the current parts

HECK YEA! 

I cannot function without VSR ever since I found out about it a few months ago!
